qas.question: Lie algebras and hypobolic quanternions drew attention to the need for what?
What did reviewer GB Mathews say algebraic structures possessed?
Reviewer Alexander Macfarlane believed that the main idea of the work is a comparative study of what?
What did Lie algebras and hyperbolic quaternions demonstrate a need for?

answers.text: the need to expand algebraic structures beyond the associatively multiplicative class

qas.question: How did Alexander Macfarlane summarize the relationship between different methods in "A Treatise on Algebra" in his review?

answers.text: comparative study of their several structures

qas.question: What was G.B. Matthew's opinion of "A Treatise on Algebra"?

answers.text: "It possesses a unity of design which is really remarkable, considering the variety of its themes."

plausible_answers.text: comparative study of their several structures

qas.question: How did Alexander Macfarlane summarize the relationship between similar methods in "A Treatise on Algebra" in his review?

plausible_answers.text: It possesses a unity of design which is really remarkable, considering the variety of its themes

qas.question: What wasnt' G.B. Matthew's opinion of "A Treatise on Algebra"?

plausible_answers.text: algebraic structures beyond the associatively multiplicative class

qas.question: What did Lie algebras and hyperbolic quaternions not demonstrate a need for?
Lie algebras and hypobolic quanternions drew attention to the lack of need for what?
What did reviewer GB Mathews say algebraic structures did not possess?
